title: Hasbro CEO Brian Goldner Takes Medical Leave, Effective Immediately; Executive was treated for prostate cancer in 2014
text:
"After careful consideration, I have decided to take a medical leave to focus on my health," Mr. Goldner said.

The leave is effective immediately, Hasbro said Sunday.

Rich Stoddart, previously lead independent director of Hasbro's board, will take over as interim CEO.

Mr. Goldner joined Hasbro in 2000 and became CEO in May 2008. He led the $4 billion acquisition of Entertainment One Ltd. in 2019, making a big bet on entertainment aimed at young children, and signed deals to cement Hasbro's hold on Star Wars, Marvel and Disney characters. The company's share price has risen more than 150% since he assumed the top job.

In July, the Pawtucket, R.I.-based company reported a 54% rise in second-quarter revenue, thanks to growth in its Wizards of the Coast and digital-gaming segment. Like many companies, it has been working to manage pandemic-driven rises in freight and input costs, as well as shipping bottlenecks.

The company will report third-quarter earnings Oct. 26.

Hasbro said that its board of directors has reappointed Edward Philip as lead independent director, and Tracy Leinbach to chair the board's Nominating, Governance and Social Responsibility Committee.
